articles.title: Kim Jong Un Goes round Combined Service Boat Mujigae
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Goes round Combined Service Boat Mujigae
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, went round newly-built combined service boat Mujigae.
					 Kim Jong Un said that if a fashionable combined service boat having various service facilities such as restaurant and cultural and welfare amenities is built to cruise between Okryu Bridge and Taedong Bridge, it will be another good place for cultural recreation of the  people, guiding its design several times and personally solving all issues arising in its building. He named the boat Mujigae.
					
					The boat with a total floor space of more than 11 390 square meters is 120 meters long and  25 meters wide and has a displacement of 3 500 tons. At least 1 230 guests can cruise in the picturesque Taedong River at a time, being served with Korean and world famous dishes.
					
					 The four storied boat has such modern service facilities as national food restaurant, coffee room, soft drink room, party room, banquet hall, buffet restaurant, deck restaurant, revolving restaurant and shop, etc.
					
					 Kim Jong Un looked round the boat to learn in detail about its building and preparations for service. 
					
					 Noting that its designing  and interior and exterior construction were done at the best level, he said with great satisfaction that everything is impeccable and formative art was applied to it at a high level.
					
					 He appreciated the installation of a peculiar round lift and the construction of round stairs, adding that the revolving restaurant on the third floor looks spectacular and it is fantastic to command a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang from it.
					
					 Noting that it is possible to regularly operate the boat only when effective measures are taken to supply foodstuff and other things to it as it has a huge accommodating capacity, he took a benevolent step for doing so.
					
					 The boat will be visited by a lot of the people, he said, adding that thinking of the people who will cheerfully laugh and talk while cruising in the river helps him relieve of the pent-up fatigue and he feels the greatest pleasure when having provided one more treasure to the people like that. He gave an instruction to start its service before October 10.
					
					 The building of the combined service boat Mujigae convinces us of the fact  that we can reach the world level in all aspects, he said, underscoring the need to build all service facilities to be constructed in the future at the level of Mujigae so that the people may enjoy a highly civilized and affluent life.
					
					 He was accompanied by Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, O Su Yong, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil and Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Jong In
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Ri Jong In
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Monday sent a wreath to the bier of anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter Ri Jong In, expressing deep condolences over her death.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Supreme Court led by First Vice-President Choe Kun Yong left here Monday to take part in the international forum of jurists to be held in Vladivostok, Russia.

articles.title: Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory
articles.content:
Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory greeted its 70th birthday.
					 The development of the factory is associated with undying feats Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero, performed for carrying into practice the lofty desire of President Kim Il Sung to give wellbeing to the people after the country's liberation from Japan's colonial rule.
					
					 In April 1947, Kim Jong Suk visited the factory to learn in detail about its operation.
					
					 Dropping in at its cake shop, she stressed the need for the factory to boost the production of sweets and cakes to be supplied to children.
					
					 She told its officials and employees about Kim Il Sung's desire to provide the children of the country with confection and inspired them to turn out in a drive for increased production.
					
					 After her visit, all the employees of the factory worked hard to remodel it and perfect its production processes in order to make a big progress in the production of confection.

articles.title: Focusing LED Lighting System Applied in DPRK
articles.content:
Focusing LED Lighting System Applied in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Power-driven Machine Institute of the DPRK State Academy of Sciences developed a focusing LED lighting system.
					 This system based on a new reflector ensures more than 90 percent light utility rate, and helps lengthen the serviceable life of a lamp by 50 000 hours on an average.
					
					 A technology of automatic high-speed charging by natural energy is applied to the system.
					
					 The new lighting system, which needs less investment and operational cost than the existing one, is of significance in enhancing the architectural aesthetic value of city structures with light decorations.

articles.title: No One Can Infringe upon DPRK's Exercise of Independent Rights: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No One Can Infringe upon DPRK's Exercise of Independent Rights: Rodong Sinmun 
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's satellite launch and measure to bolster up its nuclear deterrence are the legitimate exercise of independent rights as a sovereign country which no one can slander or infringe upon, observes Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article. 
					 It is entirely legitimate right of the DPRK to foil the aggressive moves of the hostile forces and protect its dignity and sovereignty with its self-defensive measures, it notes, and goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are terming the DPRK's exercise of independent right concerning the satellite launch "a provocation" and "violation of resolution" and crying out for "joint counteraction" with the U.S. This is a provocation of robbers.
					
					 What merits serious attention is that the chief executive of south Korea is spearheading the campaign for eliciting cooperation with outside forces to put pressure upon the DPRK, talking about "consequences of the provocation." This is an open declaration of her intention to hurt the DPRK in cooperation with outside forces. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should clearly know that their act of deliberately slandering and challenging the DPRK's exercise of its independent rights is nothing helpful to the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and they deserve condemnation. 
					
					 We will never allow the reckless moves of the south Korean authorities to achieve their sinister scenario through cooperation in putting pressure upon the dignified DPRK, vilifying its exercise of independent rights. 
					
					 Inviolable is the DPRK's exercise of independent rights.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses against DPRK Citizen
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Human Rights Abuses against DPRK Citizen 
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- DPRK citizen Kim Ryon Hui, who had gone abroad to visit relatives some years ago, was lured by a flesh trafficker to be taken to south Korea.
					 She asked the south to send her back, explaining she came to the south against her will but her desire has not yet come true.
					
					 With the only idea of going back home, she attempted to smuggle herself into a foreign country and even staged a hunger strike. She served 9 months in jail on charges of committing a crime.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This being a hard reality, the south Korean authorities let loose a spate of groundless assertion that this was "her will" and persistently prevented her from going back home.
					
					 This incident goes to prove the despicable human rights abuses of the south Korean authorities which make no scruple of kidnapping and flesh trafficking in a bid to escalate the confrontation with compatriots and which mercilessly violate even the rights of human being to live in harmony together with families.
					
					 It is disgusting to see those, who are unaware of where to draw the line, talking about the "human rights" of someone.
					
					 No one would want to live in south Korea, a veritable hell and barren land of human rights.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should look back upon the human rights crimes they committed against the DPRK citizen and send her back to the DPRK where her kinsfolk are waiting, not resorting to the anti-DPRK provocation while talking about the "human rights in the north".

articles.title: Remarks of University Professor under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Remarks of University Professor under Fire in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Students of Korea University of south Korea denounced the pro-Japanese remarks made by Prof. Jong An Gi on September 22, according to Yonhap News of south Korea. 
					 In a lecture on September 15 Jong insulted the victims of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and participants in the independence movement and shielded pro-Japanese lackeys, claiming that victims of sexual slavery were not slaves and that all Koreans were pro-Japanese ones in the period of the Japanese imperialists' rule. 
					
					 The students demanded the university side dismiss Jong An Gi for his pro-Japanese remarks. 
					
					 They also urged Jong to make an open apology to the victims of sexual slavery and the descendants of the participants of the independence movement.

articles.title: DPRK's Birth Anniversary Observed by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
DPRK's Birth Anniversary Observed by Foreign Newspapers
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Uruguayan and Senegalese newspapers carried special write-ups to mark the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on September 8 carried an article titled "President Kim Il Sung and DPRK" illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The paper said that the development history of the DPRK shining as a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence would be unthinkable without the nation-building exploit performed by the President.
					
					 It noted that the President who liberated the country and led the anti-imperialist and anti-U.S. struggle to a victory consolidated the military foundation of the DPRK with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 It stressed that the President's nation-building cause has been successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un who succeeded Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Senegalese paper Le Populaire on September 9 carried an article illustrated with a photo of the President. 
					
					 Referring to the reasons of invincibility of socialist Korea, it said that the DPRK holds the great leader in high esteem and has a distinguished guiding idea and people regarding socialism as their lifeblood.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Political Figure Praises WPK's History
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Political Figure Praises WPK's History
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, released a statement on September 23 on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 He said:
					
					 The 70-year history of the WPK is a glorious one as it turned the DPRK into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in the economy and self-reliant in defence and led the cause of Korean-style socialism and the cause of human independence to a brilliant victory despite all sorts of trials.
					
					 The WPK headed by First Secretary Kim Jong Un is leading the Korean revolution to a victory, demonstrating its dignity as the party of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and the Korean people are setting a worldwide model in their struggle for defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country and building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Being firmly convinced that the WPK, the Korean People's Army and people under the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Un would achieve a final victory in their historic struggle for realizing the reunification of the country and building a thriving nation, we extend full support and solidarity to the WPK and the Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: Korean Books Donated to Russia
articles.content:
Korean Books Donated to Russia
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A ceremony for donating Korean books to Russia took place at Far Eastern State University of Russia on September 24.
					 Present at the ceremony were figures of the mission of the Russian Foreign Ministry in Vladivostok, Maritime Territorial National Library Named after Maxim Gorky and the university and masses and officials of the DPRK mission in Nakhodka.
					
					 Korean books were handed over.
					
					 They included works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books introducing the socio-politics, history and culture of Korea.
					
					 The acting representative of the mission of the Russian Foreign Ministry in Vladivostok said:
					
					 Significant this year is the year of Russia-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Mutual cooperation and exchange are energetically pushed forward in many fields of the two countries including politics, economy, culture, education, arts and sports. 
					
					 The current ceremony will serve as an important occasion for developing the relations of cultural cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 We wish the Korean people great success in building a thriving socialist nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un who is carrying forward the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The curator of the library noted that the donated books would help the Russian people know better about the DPRK. He expressed the conviction that the Russia-DPRK friendly relations would grow stronger in all fields.

articles.title: British Organization Praises WPK
articles.content:
British Organization Praises WPK
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted a special write-up titled "Party praised by the people" illustrated with an art piece depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il standing together on Mt. Paektu on its website on September 22 on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The article said:
					
					 The Korean people ardently praise the WPK to mark its 70th founding anniversary.
					
					 It was because the WPK has fulfilled its responsibility for the destiny of the people, always defended their interests and fully served them.
					
					 In the closing year of the last century when socialism collapsed in several countries all at once, the DPRK defended socialism. This was another example showing the full responsibility of the WPK for the destiny of the popular masses.
					
					 When the DPRK suffered from the worst trials and difficulties by the imperialist allied forces' offensive against socialism and continuous natural disasters, the people-oriented policies were invariably enforced in the DPRK.
					
					 Today the WPK is dynamically leading the building of a thriving socialist nation to realize all ideals and dreams of the people under the uplifted banner of the people-first doctrine.
					
					 The WPK receiving absolute trust and ardent praise from the people will always be invincible.

articles.title: WPK's Founding Anniversary Observed Abroad
articles.content:
WPK's Founding Anniversary Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Events took place in the period between September 17 and 23 on the occasion of the 70th founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 They included photo and book exhibitions and film shows in Pakistan, Romania and Nigeria.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Also on display there were their works, and books and photos introducing the WPK's history of victory and glory.
					
					 Films shown included Korean films "Fireworks of a Thriving Nation" and "Monument to Party Founding".
					
					 The director of the Secretariat of the Pakistan People's Party said that Korea was reduced to a colony of foreign forces because of the weak national power but it has demonstrated its might as a genuine socialist power. It was thanks to the great leaders and the leadership of the WPK.
					
					 The chairman of the Socialist Party of Romania noted that the venue of the exhibition made him know better about the undying exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the foundation and development of the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre nuevo barco de servicio combinado Mujigae
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre nuevo barco de servicio combinado Mujigae
						
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio el barco de servicio combinado Mujigae, nuevamente construido.
					Al decir que se puede ofrecer al pueblo un lugar de descanso si  navega en el rio entre los puentes Okryu y Taedong un barco dispuesto de comedor y otros establecimientos culturales y servicios publicos, el Mariscal dirigio en varias ocasiones la labor de disenar, soluciono todos los problemas pendientes en la construccion del navio y lo denomino como Mujigae.
					
					El barco puede ofrecer a la vez a mas de mil 230 clientes las comidas nacionales y las otras afamadas extranjeras, navegando por el pintoresco rio Taedong. Su superficie total es de mas de 11 mil 390 metros cuadrados, su largo, de 120 metros, su ancho, de 25 metros y su desplazamiento, de 3 mil 500 toneladas.
					
					La nave de 4 pisos cuenta con comedor de platos nacionales, cafeteria, refresqueria, comedor en compania, lugar de banquete, comedor de buffet, comedor al aire libre en cubierta,  comedor giratorio, tienda y otras instalaciones de servicio.
					
					Recorriendo el barco, el Mariscal averiguo detalladamente el estado de la construccion y preparativos de actividades de servicio.
					
					Tras evaluar el hecho de que se hicieron bien el diseno y la obra interior y exterior del barco, se sentia muy satisfecho diciendo que todos los puntos del barco son perfectas y llevan el caracter plastico y artistico en alto nivel.
					
					Viendo el ascensor redondo y la escalera espiral, los evaluo y dijo que es muy magnifico el comedor giratorio acondicionado en cuarto piso y es muy vistoso el paisaje de Pyongyang al ver desde alli.
					
					Subrayo que el barco de gran capacidad se puede gestionar normalmente cuando se toma una esmera medida de suministro de materias primas y tomo las medidas para el fin.
					
					Muchos habitantes lo visitaran con mucho gusto, senalo el Mariscal y agrego que al imaginarlo, se alivia la fatiga acumulada y cuando se preparen uno por uno las riquezas para el  pueblo se siente muy alegre. Y luego instruyo comenzar el  servicio del barco antes del dia 10 de octubre.
					
					Destaco que a traves de la construccion del barco, llegamos a tener el orgullo de que podemos alcanzar en todas las esferas el nivel mundial y enfatizo que para ofrecer a nuestro pueblo una vida culta y civilizada, debemos construir todas las instalaciones de servicio como el barco Mujigae.
					
					Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, O Su Yong, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil y Kim Yo Jong.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Ri Jong In
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Ri Jong In
						
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 28 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro de la difunta Ri Jong In, combatiente revolucionaria antijaponesa, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Coreanos rinden homenaje a martires en ocasion de fiesta otonal
articles.content:
Coreanos rinden homenaje a martires en ocasion de fiesta otonal
						
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo de Chusok (fiesta otonal, el 15 de agosto lunar) fueron colocadas el dia 27 las ofrendas florales ante el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong, el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos en la comuna Sinmi y el Cementerio de Martires de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					Estaban colocadas alli las ofrendas florales enviadas por el Mariscal Kim Jong Un.
					
					En las ceremonias de homenaje participaron Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju y otros cuadros directivos del Partido, el Estado y el ejercito, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el poder, entidades sociales, ministerios y organos centrales, oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea y trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Fueron colocadas en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios en el Monte Taesong las ofrendas florales a nombre del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, una ofrenda floral a nombre comun del Comite Central del PTC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC en el Cementerio de Martires Patrioticos en la comuna Sinmi, y la otra a nombre comun del Comite Central y la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC en el Cementerio de Martires de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					Ademas, fueron puestas las ofrendas florales a nombre del Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, entidades sociales, ministerios, organos centrales, unidades del EPC y del ESIPC, instituciones de ciencia, educacion, salud publica, prensa e informacion, organismos del partido y el poder, empresas, fabricas y granjas en esta capital.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires quienes quedaron infinitamente fieles al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il y dedicaron la juventud y la vida para la liberacion y la prosperidad de la patria y el cumplimiento de la causa revolucionaria del Juche.
					
					Luego, recorrieron los cementerios.
					
					El mismo dia, fueron depositadas las ofrendas florales ante las estatuas de bronce de los martires, el cementerio de ellos, el monumento a los martires del ejercito popular y sus tumbas, en distintos lugares.
